data.title: The Key To Music Research Project by Robert Fontana
data.meta_description: Introductory post Part one: The Keys to the 50's Part two: The Keys to the 60's Part three: The Keys to the 70's Part four: The Keys to the 80's Part five: The Keys to the 90's Part six: The Keys to the 00's Robert will also be creating a website for the project, which…
data.text:
Introductory post

Part one: The Keys to the 50’s

Part two: The Keys to the 60’s

Part three: The Keys to the 70’s

Part four: The Keys to the 80’s

Part five: The Keys to the 90’s

Part six: The Keys to the 00’s

Robert will also be creating a website for the project, which will include every #1 song from 1955-present, their keys, stats, charts, a Predicto-Key which will forecast the key of the next #1, and a forum for discussion. He will be sure to let out a mruff on here once it’s up and running.

My pet project involves the analysis of any possible correlations involved with key signatures of all the Billboard Hot 100 #1’s from 1955 to our present day and age (so basically since the Rock era started). I’ve been recording the keys (including any full transpositions – not secondary tonicizations) of this comprehensive list of songs. My analysis will include results of most popular & least popular key signatures of all #1 songs as well as per decade, reasons why certain keys may have been chosen during particular time frames, the possibility that certain keys appeal more to audiences, and other musically-geeky probing.

Robert Fontana
